vampire.processing.raster_utils module¶

vampire.processing.raster_utils.mask_by_shapefile_arc(raster_file, polygon_file, output_file, gdal_path, nodata=None)[source]¶
vampire.processing.raster_utils.reproject_cut(slave, box=None, t_srs=None, s_srs=None, res=None)[source]¶

This function reprojects an image (slave) to match the extent, resolution and projection of another (master) using GDAL. The newly reprojected image is a GDAL VRT file for efficiency. A different spatial resolution can be chosen by specifyign the optional res parameter. The function returns the new file’s name. Parameters ————- master: str

A filename (with full path if required) with the master image (that that will be taken as a reference)
slave: str
A filename (with path if needed) with the image that will be reprojected
res: float, optional
The desired output spatial resolution, if different to the one in master.

The reprojected filename TODO Have a way of controlling output filename

vampire.processing.raster_utils.reproject_image_to_master(master, slave, output, res=None, nodata=0.0)[source]¶

This function reprojects an image (slave) to match the extent, resolution and projection of another (master) using GDAL. The newly reprojected image is a GDAL VRT file for efficiency. A different spatial resolution can be chosen by specifyign the optional res parameter. The function returns the new file’s name. Parameters ————- master: str

A filename (with full path if required) with the master image (that that will be taken as a reference)
slave: str
A filename (with path if needed) with the image that will be reprojected
res: float, optional
The desired output spatial resolution, if different to the one in master.

The reprojected filename TODO Have a way of controlling output filename
